title: Hindustan Times
summary: Hindustan Times is an Indian English-language daily newspaper[2] introduced and founded in 1924 by Sunder Singh Lyallpuri, founder-father of the Akali movement and the Shiromani Akali Dal in the Punjab Province. It played integral roles in the Indian independence movement as a nationalist daily.[3][4][5] The newspaper is owned by Shobhana Bhartia.[6] It is the flagship publication of HT Media, an entity controlled by the KK Birla family.[7][8]
